cause.description:
FOR AFRICA: A benefit and Celebration for the Children of Ghana. This Benefit is a project that is on going with Chris Burnside, VCU School of Social Work, and VCU students enrolled in the Making a Difference Independent Study course, as well as community members and some partnerships with local and international organizations. Sovereign Global Mission is a Ghanaian orgranization co-founded by Reverend Eric and Felisha Annon in order to address the issues of poverty in and around the Ghanaian capital of Accra. This performance will represent the culture that Africa and Ghana in particular have to offer while raising money to fund the construction of The Center for Street children which is projected to house and educate around 500 street children from the city and rural surrounding areas.
1. Poverty is devastating, Ghanians live on less than $1 a day.
2. $36,000 to build a Center for Street children to house, educate and feed approx. 500 kids.
cause.mission: raise money to help shelter, educate and feed orphaned children in and around Accra, Ghana.
cause.name: For Africa: Center for Street Children
